# PhysicalProjection { #flood_adapt.objects.PhysicalProjection }

```python
objects.PhysicalProjection()
```

The accepted input for a physical projection in FloodAdapt.

## Attributes {.doc-section .doc-section-attributes}

<code>[**sea_level_rise**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[us](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.unit_system`).[UnitfulLength](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.unit_system.UnitfulLength`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The sea level rise in meters. Default=us.UnitfulLength(0.0, us.UnitTypesLength.meters).

<code>[**subsidence**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[us](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.unit_system`).[UnitfulLength](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.unit_system.UnitfulLength`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The subsidence in meters. Default=us.UnitfulLength(0.0, us.UnitTypesLength.meters).

<code>[**rainfall_multiplier**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[float](`float`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The rainfall multiplier. Default = 1.0.

<code>[**storm_frequency_increase**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[float](`float`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The storm frequency increase as a percentage. Default = 0.0.
